extracted_data.oldest_reference_title: Toward the therapeutic editing of mutated RNA sequences
extracted_data.oldest_reference_authors: Woolf TM, Chase JM, Stinchcomb DT
extracted_data.citation_claim: Directing edits to correct mutated sequences was first proposed and demonstrated in 1995. This initial work used synthetic RNA antisense oligonucleotides complementary to a pre-mature stop codon mutation in a dystrophin sequence to activate A-to-I editing of the stop codon to a read through codon in a model xenopus cell system.
